title: Job: I Long to Find God
summary: Job expresses a deep desire to present his case to God directly. He believes he would be vindicated, but he feels God is hidden from him. Still, he affirms that God knows the way he takes.

faq.question: What does Job want in this chapter?
faq.answer: To find God and plead his case before Him.

faq.question: Does Job still trust God?
faq.answer: Yesâ€”he says, 'When He has tested me, I will come forth as gold.'
